The crack has been detected :( 

I never touched "update", but I've been notified that the software will expire in 30 days.

to prevent crack detection, add these lines to your host file (google it if you don't know how):

127.0.0.1 www.dumeter.com
127.0.0.1 dumeter.com
127.0.0.1 www.hageltech.com
127.0.0.1 hageltech.com

that way the program won't be able to phone home and revert itself to unregistered

enjoy! :)

A window popped up yesterday saying, "You are using a illegal version of du meter, with a crying face next to it." It appears they found a way to void this version? It worked for a couple months before this.
manufacturer has screen showing that this is pirated software seems to be when it updates and there is no option to keep it from updating

As others, the crack is reseted because dumeter connect to the website, discover the program is cracked and tell me I'm on 15 days of 30 days unregistered.

I get this message one or two times per month. I close dumeter and launch the automated crack again. Everything goes back to normal until the next time dumeter connects to the website 2 or 3 weeks later.

The other method I've just discovered is with Windows hosts file. By entering:

127.0.0.1 www.dumeter.com
127.0.0.1 dumeter.com
127.0.0.1 www.hageltech.com
127.0.0.1 hageltech.com


in the hosts file, it blocks the program to connect on the website. If I go to the "check for update", dumeter reports a connection error. :) If it can't connect, it will not discover my version is cracked.

So you have to edit the hosts.txt file. You need admin user privilege to do this. You MUST launch Notepad in â€œRun as Administratorâ€œ. I first launch it normally, impossible to save the hosts file.

More here:

http://www.windowsreference.com/windows-7/edit-hosts-file-in-windows-7-windows-vista/

And as asual: thanks ChattChitto. :)

By the way, there is a new version of Dumeter out dude, if someone could contact ChattChitto and kindly ask him if he could release this version, it would be great.
